channel.title: BBC Sport

item.title: Semenyo scores twice as Bournemouth beat Fulham
item.description: Antoine Semenyo nets twice and Justin Kluivert scores a screamer as Bournemouth come from behind to beat Fulham in stormy conditions and move up to second in the Premier League table.

item.title: Amorim says Man Utd 'need results to continue project'
item.description: Manchester United head coach Ruben Amorim admits he cannot hide from his dire record and it is 'normal' that Old Trafford legends criticise him.

item.title: Postecoglou retains Forest support but pressure growing
item.description: Ange Postecoglou retains the immediate support of the Nottingham Forest hierarchy but pressure is growing following a winless start to his reign.

item.title: 'Tuchel ends days of starstruck coaches automatically picking big names'
item.description: Thomas Tuchel's decision to ignore Jude Bellingham's desire to be in his England squad shows he will not get star treatment, writes Phil McNulty.

item.title: Man Utd face Fernandes decision - Saturday's gossip
item.description: Manchester United's desire to hold to captain Bruno Fenandes in January is set to be tested, Liverpool keen on Bayern Munich defender Dayot Upamecano and more.

item.title: Why Liverpool aren't getting the best from Wirtz yet
item.description: A deep dive into Florian Wirtz's performances for Liverpool so far and why he isn't yet at his best.

item.title: Man Utd & Man City to pay tribute to synagogue attack victims
item.description: Manchester United and Manchester City will pay tribute to the victims of the Manchester synagogue attack before their Premier League fixtures this weekend.

item.title: Savinho extends Man City contract until 2031
item.description: Manchester City winger Savinho signs a two-year contract extension, keeping him at the club until 2031.

item.title: Sutton's predictions v Idlewild guitarist Rod Jones & AI
item.description: BBC Sport football expert Chris Sutton takes on Idlewild guitarist Rod Jones with his predictions for this weekend's Premier League fixtures.

item.title: Sandberg stunner earns Man Utd point against Chelsea
item.description: Anna Sandberg's stunning volley secures Manchester United's second ever Women's Super League point against defending champions Chelsea in their 1-1 draw at Leigh Sports Village.

item.title: Iraola full of praise for Semenyo after win over Fulham
item.description: Bournemouth manager Andoni Iraola is pleased and gives credit to the players' performances as two goals from Antoine Semenyo gives the Cherries a comfortable 3-1 win over Fulham at the Vitality Stadium.

item.title: El Mala strike sends Koln into Bundesliga top four
item.description: Said El Mala's superb strike gives Koln their first win in four games, a 1-0 victory at Hoffenheim which moves the visitors into the Bundesliga's top four.

item.title: Silva reflects on 'very difficult' defeat
item.description: Fulham manager Marco Silva reflects on a "very difficult" 3-1 Premier League defeat to Bournemouth at the Vitality Stadium.

item.title: 'No problem' with Bellingham - Tuchel
item.description: England manager Thomas Tuchel says there is "no problem" with Jude Bellingham, or the other players he left out of the squad including Phil Foden and Jack Grealish, that will face Wales and Latvia this month.

item.title: Are fears over Maresca's Chelsea future unfair?
item.description: With some suggesting Enzo Maresca is under pressure at Chelsea, what are the causes of their downturn and are they the manager's fault?

item.title: No problem with Bellingham, Foden or Grealish - Tuchel
item.description: Thomas Tuchel says he has "no problem" with Jude Bellingham, Phil Foden or Jack Grealish after leaving them out of his England squad.

item.title: Defenders not as good as they were in my day - Rooney
item.description: Wayne Rooney says the current crop of defenders are not as good as they were in his day - and rates the top five best he played against.

item.title: How generation of cool keepers silenced trolls
item.description: The standard of female goalkeepers used to be criticised in football - but now they dominate headlines for the right reasons. What's behind their progress?

item.title: Edinburgh derby, Motherwell's Watt & Martin in spotlight again
item.description: In this weekend's Premiership games, there's a focus on the first Edinburgh derby of the season, a potential difference-maker for Motherwell at Celtic Park and a spotlight on Russell Martin, again.

item.title: Difficult to put timeline on Alisson injury - Slot
item.description: Liverpool goalkeeper Alisson will miss Saturday's trip to Chelsea with a hamstring injury.

item.title: Injured Yamal out of Spain World Cup qualifiers
item.description: Barcelona winger Lamine Yamal is out for "two to three weeks" with a groin injury and misses Spain's World Cup qualifying matches against Georgia and Bulgaria.

item.title: Arsenal open talks with Timber over new deal
item.description: Arsenal open talks with Netherlands defender Jurrien Timber over a new contract.

item.title: 'Awful' & 'ridiculous' - but was VAR really to blame for Celtic defeat?
item.description: Celtic were angered by the decision to rule out a goal against Sporting Braga, but were they at fault for their own downfall?

item.title: Real Madrid cool Konate interest - Friday's gossip
item.description: Real Madrid cool interest in Liverpool defender Ibrahima Konate, Manchester United want Brentford's Yehor Yarmolyuk while Newcastle eye Athletic Club's Oihan Sancet, plus more.

item.title: Livramento recovery forecast 'good news' - Howe
item.description: Newcastle manager Eddie Howe says Tino Livramento's eight-week recovery forecast is "good news" but the wait for Yoane Wissa's debut will be "slightly longer".

item.title: All change for high-pressure East Anglia derby
item.description: Ipswich Town meet Norwich City in the first East Anglia derby of the season, with both having a huge turnover of players.

item.title: Tottenham midfielder Bentancur signs new contract
item.description: Tottenham midfielder Rodrigo Bentancur signs a new "long-term" deal with the club.

item.title: What did Taylor Swift sing about Real Madrid?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team looks at what Taylor Swift has said about Spanish football club Real Madrid.

item.title: Martin's mentality mantra soundtracks another Rangers loss
item.description: After another defeat for Rangers, Russell Martin says mentality is to blame and not the tactical approach of his team.

item.title: What are penalty retake rules after Roma penalty drama?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains the rules on penalty retakes after Roma took the same penalty three times against Lille in the Europa League

item.title: Are Aberdeen showing signs of releasing handbrake?
item.description: Despite defeat by Shakhtar Donetsk, Aberdeen boss Jimmy Thelin was encouraged on Thursday.

item.title: Five things to watch in EFL - derby drama & old faces reunited
item.description: Five things to keep an eye on in the EFL this weekend, including the East Anglian derby and reunions with familiar faces.

item.title: O'Neill unmoved by Nagelsmann's 'long ball' remark
item.description: Northern Ireland manager Michael O'Neill says it is not his job to set up the team for any "other manager to come and beat" his side.

item.title: 'Hungry' Palace's unbeaten run hits record 19 games
item.description: From being 18th in the Premier League and worryingly without a win just a year ago, Crystal Palace are flying high after setting a new club record of 19 unbeaten games.

item.title: Premier League set to decide on PSR alternative
item.description: A decision on whether to scrap the Premier League's profit and sustainability rules and adopt an "alternative system" is "coming up", says Richard Masters.

item.title: 'I heard their opinion' - Postecoglou undaunted as Forest fans want him sacked
item.description: Ange Postecoglou remains defiant despite Nottingham Forest fans turning on the new manager after a sixth game without a win.

item.title: Tickets, bots & touts - is Chelsea relationship with fans turning sour?
item.description: Chelsea are back in the Champions League, but relations between parts of the fanbase and the club hierarchy have turned sour.

item.title: How Park's move from Man City to Man Utd has made 'huge difference'
item.description: Alex Scott, Ellen White and Fara Williams reflect on Jess Park's player of the match winning performance and why she 'suits' playing for Manchester United.

item.title: Sandberg 'screamer' draws Man Utd level with Chelsea
item.description: Anna Sandberg scores a "screamer" to draw Manchester United level with Chelsea in the first half of their WSL game at the Progress with Unity Stadium.

item.title: Meet Wolves' 'superstar' chef
item.description: Wolves' performance head chef Melissa Forde tells BBC Sport's Dan Ogunshakin about bringing a "bit of home" to the players' dishes.

item.title: Rodgers perplexed at Celtic disallowed goal
item.description: Celtic manager Brendan Rodgers says he has not had an explanation as to why their equaliser against Sporting Braga was disallowed for handball in their Europa League defeat.

item.title: 'Astonishing' Kane & Mbappe reaching record levels
item.description: Champions League pundit Rory Smith discusses the "astonishing" levels Harry Kane and Kylian Mbappe are reaching this season as both forwards grabbed goals in match week two of the Champions League.

item.title: 'Defenders work harder than attackers' - Man Utd confessions
item.description: Manchester United players including Ella Toone, Millie Turner, Phallon Tullis-Joyce and Gabby George get a few things off their chests about their team-mates in Confession Cam.

item.title: Guardiola has 'nothing to say' to referee after late Monaco penalty
item.description: Manchester City boss Pep Guardiola admits he has "nothing to say" to the referee after the official awarded a penalty to Monaco late on in their 2-2 draw in the Champions League.

item.title: Bowen earns new West Ham boss Nuno draw at Everton
item.description: Watch Premier League highlights as new West Ham United manager Nuno Espirito Santo earns a draw at Everton in his first match in charge.

item.title: 'Special One' returns - relive Mourinho's first Chelsea news conference
item.description: Before manager Jose Mourinho's Champions League return to Stamford Bridge with Benfica, relive the 2004 news conference that introduced him to English football as the 'Special One'.

item.title: Liverpool are a 'work in progress' - Sutton
item.description: Former Premier League striker Chris Sutton discusses Liverpool's defensive frailties at the start of this season and why there are some worries.

item.title: Arsenal lead set-piece trend as NFL tactics spread
item.description: Umir Irfan looks at how football teams are using blocking moves at set-pieces in a similar way to how NFL players block their opponents.

item.title: Is Nuno the right man for West Ham?
item.description: BBC Sport looks at how Nuno Espirito Santo might fit in as West Ham manager, based on his recent experience with Nottingham Forest.

item.title: Can set-piece coach get Newcastle's giants firing again?
item.description: Newcastle United have only scored one goal from set-plays this season and boss Eddie Howe knows his towering side have "work to do".

item.title: 'A culture to win' - how have Man City turned form around?
item.description: After the disappointing end to August, September had the potential to turn into a crisis for Manchester City and manager Pep Guardiola, but they have turned their form around.

item.title: On the beach with Arteta and love of reading - Iraola in his own words
item.description: Andoni Iraola sits down with Kelly Somers to discuss playing with Mikel Arteta and wanting to be remembered as a good person.

item.title: Transfers - September to December 2025
item.description: Check out the significant signings and departures in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, EFL and Women's Super League.

item.title: Manager ins and outs - 2025-26 season
item.description: BBC Sport tracks all the manager ins and outs in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, Women's Super League, English Football League and National League.

item.title: Why are Kazakhstan part of Uefa?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains why Kazakhstan are part of Uefa.

item.title: Why are some football shin pads so small?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explore why some football shin pads are so small, and what the laws are around wearing them.

item.title: Why was Calafiori banned from using a towel for throw-ins?
item.description: Arsenal's Riccardo Calafiori was stopped from drying the ball with a towel against Newcastle - but why did that happen?

item.title: What is meldonium and can it enhance a footballer's performance?
item.description: Meldonium use has led to significant bans for several prominent athletes.

item.title: What is the Champions League anthem?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team look at how the Champions League anthem was created and what the lyrics are.

item.title: Is the Premier League getting younger?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything looks into why increasing number of teenagers and young players are playing in the Premier League this season.

item.title: Will previous calls sway Rangers as Martin pressure mounts?
item.description: Russell Martin is under intense pressure at Rangers but does a recent history of chopping and changing managers at Ibrox work in his favour?

item.title: Edinburgh derby in numbers as Hearts & Hibs face off
item.description: BBC Sport Scotland sets the scene for the first Edinburgh derby of the season.

item.title: Fans facing 'extremely worrying' safety conditions at Uefa matches
item.description: Fans groups tell the BBC that travel bans and restrictions are putting football supporters' safety and dignity at risk in Uefa competitions

item.title: Where will Barcelona host Champions League football?
item.description: Barcelona are set to play their Champions League home games away from their iconic Nou Camp home.

item.title: Lamine Yamal - the eve of a new football era
item.description: Barcelona teenager Lamine Yamal missed out on becoming the youngest Ballon d'Or winner, but he is destined to create a new footballing era, writes Guillem Balague.

item.title: London to host inaugural Women's Champions Cup
item.description: London will host the final matches in the new Women's Champions Cup early next year, with European champions Arsenal among the four competing teams.

item.title: Is Beever-Jones making case to be Chelsea and England number nine?
item.description: Chelsea striker Aggie Beever-Jones has four goals in four WSL games and is making a strong case for an England starting place.

item.title: BBC to show live Women's Champions League matches
item.description: BBC Sport signs a five-year deal to broadcast live Women's Champions League matches from this season.

item.title: From farming village to Liverpool icon - the Salah story
item.description: BBC Sport visits Egypt to discover what Mohamed Salah means to the people of the football-mad country, and how a small boy from humble beginnings became a national icon.

item.title: Napoli 'smell blood' & target Premier League's discarded stars
item.description: After Scott McTominay was a hit, Napoli went back to the Premier League for Kevin de Bruyne, could more players follow them to Serie A?

item.title: How does Daniel Levy run Tottenham - and would he ever leave?
item.description: With Tottenham struggling on the pitch and chairman Daniel Levy facing criticism from fans, BBC Sport looks at how the club is run and what the future might hold.

item.title: When River Plate icon Diaz took over fourth-tier Oxford
item.description: Twenty years on from Ramon Diaz's surprising appointment at Oxford United, BBC Sport looks at what happened and how it went.

item.title: East meets west London - the mentor who changed Chelsea
item.description: Vinay Menon knew nothing about football when he went for a meeting at a west London mansion in 2009. A few weeks later he was in the heart of the Chelsea dressing room.

item.title: The air crash and the underdogs - a triumph for a lost generation
item.description: Nineteen years and 10 miles separated Zambia's football team from a lost, golden generation on a fateful night in Libreville.

item.title: The rise and fall of North Korea - the sleeping giant of women's football
item.description: North Korea lags behind most of the rest of the world in several areas. But the hermit state has had an outsized impact on international women's football.
